channel.title: Gawker
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Jay Z's Picasso Baby: A Performance Art Film will premiere on HBO on Friday, August 2 at 11 p.m.
item.description:
Jay Z's Picasso Baby: A Performance Art Film will premiere on HBO on Friday, August 2 at 11 p.m. We'll finally get to see what Vines look like in HD.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Rich Juzwiak

item.title: Unarmed Man Shot by Deputies Inside His Own Car Outside His Own Home
item.description:
Deputies in Florida's Escambia County have some explaining to do after they allegedly shot an unarmed man for grabbing a box of cigarettes out of his own car outside his own house.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Neetzan Zimmerman

item.title: Lady Gaga on her upcoming single, "Applause": "...What I’m saying in the song essentially is that I
item.description:
Lady Gaga on her upcoming single, "Applause": "...What I’m saying in the song essentially is that I live for the applause. I live for the way you cheer and scream for me. Give me that thing that I love. Put your hands up, make them touch." I never would have guessed.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Rich Juzwiak

item.title: Gerrymandering Is Eating Democracy
item.description:
It's strange that national political races grow ever more expensive, and our national political discussion grows ever more atomized and partisan, at the same time that Congressional elections are less competitive than ever, by design. Why are we all yelling at each other when we should be yelling at gerrymandering?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Hamilton Nolan

item.title: Former Teacher Tears Into Anthony Weiner for Conduct Unbecoming a Mayor
item.description:
If you thought losing his campaign manager was the worst of the fallout for sext machine Anthony Weiner, you clearly haven't seen this blazingly heated exchange between the mayoral candidate and a retired Staten Island teacher named Peg Brunda.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Neetzan Zimmerman

item.title: Publicis and Omnicom, two staggeringly huge conglomerates of advertising and PR agencies, are combin
item.description:
Publicis and Omnicom, two staggeringly huge conglomerates of advertising and PR agencies, are combining into one even more staggeringly huge conglomerate, as we march towards a bright future in which one ad company sells all ads to one media company, which controls all entertainment.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Hamilton Nolan

item.title: Gay Priests Coming Out? Pope Says He Won't “Judge” Gay Clergy
item.description:
Liberals around the world applauded Pope Francis for meeting the bare minimum standard of human decency on Monday by saying, when asked about the possibility of gay priests, "If someone is gay and he searches for the Lord and has good will, who am I to judge?"

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Read

item.title: Japanese University Makes Special “Forever Alone” Dining Tables
item.description:
One of Japan's most prestigious institutions, Kyoto University, has installed new lunchroom seats for students who don't want others to watch them while they eat. Alone.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Brian Ashcraft on Kotaku, shared by Leah Beckmann to Gawker

item.title: After having bananas thrown at her during a political rally, Cécile Kyenge, Italy's first black mini
item.description:
After having bananas thrown at her during a political rally, Cécile Kyenge, Italy's first black minister, told reporters that she would continue doing her job and that protesters should stop "wasting food."

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: Thief Steals $50 Million in Jewelry in French Riviera Heist
item.description:
A thief holding a gun hauled in around $50 million worth of jewelry during a brazen heist in Cannes Sunday morning.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: Rush Limbaugh and Sean Hannity are reportedly getting dropped by Cumulus Media, which will remove th
item.description:
Rush Limbaugh and Sean Hannity are reportedly getting dropped by Cumulus Media, which will remove them from the radio in over 40 major markets.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: Israel and Palestine Will Resume Peace Talks Again After Three Years
item.description:
After a push by Secretary of State John Kerry, Israel and Palestine have agreed to resume peace negotiations for the first time in three years.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: It just gets worse.
item.description:
It just gets worse. Turns out that Anthony Weiner spent $43,100 in campaign money to investigate the hacking of his Twitter in 2011. Thing is, he knew he was lying about the supposed hacking the entire time.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: Vladimir Putin Catches, Kisses the Biggest Pike Ever
item.description:
Russian strongman/president Vladimir Putin went fishing last weekend and caught a pike as large as the Siberian tundra. Or at least, it was reported to be as large.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: The Wolverine led the box office this weekend with $55 million (which is actually considered a disap
item.description:
The Wolverine led the box office this weekend with $55 million (which is actually considered a disappointment), while indie Fruitvale Station cracked the top ten with $4.7 million.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: Anthony Weiner's Campaign Manager Quit
item.description:
Danny Kedem, the campaign manager for Anthony Weiner's embattled run for mayor of New York finally quit yesterday, after this week's campaign-crushing revelation that Weiner continued to sext with strangers long after he left congress (and that he sent strangers more pictures of his dong).

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: The driver of the speedboat that crashed into a barge Friday night on the Hudson River, killing a br
item.description:
The driver of the speedboat that crashed into a barge Friday night on the Hudson River, killing a bride-to-be and the best man, has been arrested on suspicion of intoxication.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: Shep Smith Goes on Weird, Amazing Rant About ﻿True Blood & Baby Names
item.description:
While covering the royal birth this week, Fox News's Shep Smith once again displayed his profound appreciation for HBO's True Blood, with an extended explanation of the name-giving procedure for faeries.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: Baton Rouge police officers have been going undercover and arresting gay men for agreeing to have co
item.description:
Baton Rouge police officers have been going undercover and arresting gay men for agreeing to have consensual sex, charging them with an "attempted crime against nature." The U.S. Supreme Court invalidated this crime more than a decade ago.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: Michael Jordan's son just tweeted a photo of his penis
item.description:
Marcus Jordan—the son of legendary NBA player Michael Jordan—just posted a picture of his dick on Twitter. Anthony Weiner approves this message.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jesus Diaz on KINJA, shared by Max Rivlin-Nadler to Gawker

item.title: 80% of All Adults in U.S. Face Near-Poverty or Unemployment
item.description:
In a sign of our part-time recovery, four out of every five American adults face joblessness or poverty at some point during their lives.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: New Zealand Tells Man He is Too Fat to Live There
item.description:
New Zealand has rejected the work visa of a chef who has been living there since 2007, all because he is simply too fat for the small island nation.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: California Cops Let Rich Crooks Buy Themselves Nicer Prison Spots
item.description:
A California police department is letting people found guilty of misdemeanors that include jail time pay fees to avoid getting put into rough prisons.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: Fox News Amazed That a Bible Scholar, Who is Muslim, Wrote About Jesus
item.description:
This is pretty amazing. Fox News's Lauren Green just can't believe that Reza Aslan, a MUSLIM, would dare write a book about the history of Jesus of Nazareth, a Jew who lived more than 2,000 years ago.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Max Rivlin-Nadler

item.title: How internet hatred can destroy your soul and dreams
item.description:
Phil Fish is the creator of a very popular and much loved video game called Fez. He's also the target of a lot of internet hatred. The latest hate burst has been so intense that he's calling it quits, canceling the second part of his original masterwork.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jesus Diaz on KINJA, shared by Max Rivlin-Nadler to Gawker
